translated: In the heart, in the middle of a variegated lotus and sun, one should meditate on the Bhagavat together with the nine syllables surrounding the syllable hūṃ.

original: de'i mdun du de dang kha sbyor zhing yang de kho na dang 'dra ba'i bcom ldan 'das gnyis pa bsgom bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mdun du de dang kha sbyor zhing yang de kho na dang 'dra ba'i bcom ldan 'das gnyis pa bsgom bar bya'o //
translated: In front of him, one should meditate on a second Bhagavat, who is in union with him and who is just like him.

original: de'i rjes su rang gi snying ga'i sngags las 'phros pa'i sngags kyi phreng ba rang gi kha nas mdun gyi bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal du zhugs shing de'i lte ba nas rang gi lte bar zhugs shing yang rang gi snying gar 'thon nas de kho na bzhin 'khor🔽bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su rang gi snying ga'i sngags las 'phros pa'i sngags kyi phreng ba rang gi kha nas mdun gyi bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal du zhugs shing de'i lte ba nas rang gi lte bar zhugs shing yang rang gi snying gar 'thon nas de kho na bzhin 'khor🔽bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should meditate on a rosary of mantras issuing from the mantra in one’s heart, entering one’s mouth, entering the mouth of the Bhagavat in front, and entering one’s navel from his navel, and again issuing from one’s heart and circulating in the same way.

original: bzlas pa'i tshe rang gi snying ga'i h'um gi 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi dang / zla ba dang / skar ma dang / sman dang / sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi'i nus pa dang / rig pa la sogs pa la mkhas pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: bzlas pa'i tshe rang gi snying ga'i h'um gi 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi dang / zla ba dang / skar ma dang / sman dang / sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi'i nus pa dang / rig pa la sogs pa la mkhas pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: When reciting, light rays from the hūṃ in one’s heart invoke the nectar of wisdom of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the moon, stars, medicine, the power of the sixty-four arts,

original: gzhan zil gyis gnon pa'i rtsod pa dang / snyan ngag la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa bkug nas rang gi snying ga'i h'um la rab tu thim zhing /
analyzed: gzhan zil gyis gnon pa'i rtsod pa dang / snyan ngag la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa bkug nas rang gi snying ga'i h'um la rab tu thim zhing /
translated: and all the qualities of expertise in knowledge and so forth, as well as all the qualities of debate and poetry that surpass others, and they dissolve into the hūṃ in one’s heart.

original: bdag nyid rig pa lnga la mkhas pa'i pandi ta yin no snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i spobs pas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid rig pa lnga la mkhas pa'i pandi ta yin no snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i spobs pas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: With the pride of thinking “I am a paṇḍita expert in the five sciences,” recite the mantra with confidence.

original: zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas pas snyan ngag mkhan chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas pas snyan ngag mkhan chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting for twenty-one days, one will become a great poet.

original: gtum po khro bo chen po'i shes rab blo 'phel gyi sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
